thread.title: Have you seen it? South Mountain Freeway construction underway
thread.title_full: Have you seen it? South Mountain Freeway construction underway

author: Laura G Mez
title: Have you seen it? South Mountain Freeway construction underway

persons.name: cheryl evans/the republic fullscreen kris johnson

text:
Have you seen it? South Mountain Freeway construction underway Laura Gómez , azcentral.com | lavozarizona.com 10:00 a.m. MT Feb. 20, 2017 CLOSE x Share According to ADOT, "the Loop 202 freeway, also known as the South Mountain Freeway, will run east and west along Pecos Road and then turn north between 55th and 63rd avenues, connecting with Interstate 10 on each end." Video credit: ADOT Roadwork is underway in Awhatukee, Laveen and parts of the West Valley Kris Johnson works on the future Loop 202 South Mountain near 40th Street and Pecos Road on Feb. 17, 2016, in Ahwatukee. The 22-mile freeway is expected to open by late 2019 and will provide a link between the East Valley and West Valley. (Photo: Cheryl Evans/The Republic) CONNECT COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
Roadwork is underway on a controversial 22-mile extension of Loop 202 that will connect the West Valley and southeast valley, bypassing downtown Phoenix. 
The South Mountain Freeway will connect Interstate 10 in Chandler to I-10 in west Phoenix. The freeway will follow Pecos Road through Ahwatukee and head north near 59th Avenue through Laveen. 
Construction of the new freeway is in full swing despite legal challenges to the project in 9th U.S. Circuit Court of Appeals. The Gila River Indian Community and environmental and community groups argue that transportation agencies did not adequately address the freeway’s effects on cultural and natural resources, as well as health impacts on neighboring communities. 
A Phoenix-based U.S. District judge ruled in August that the project can proceed , but those findings were appealed. The 9th U.S. Circuit Court of Appeals denied injunctions to halt the project last month, but the appeals court could still block the freeway. South Mountain Freeway stories Judge refuses to block freeway 
The freeway is expected to open in late 2019 with four lanes in each direction, three general-use lanes and one HOV lane. 
The freeway's path will include 13 new traffic interchanges and 40 bridges, according to Dustin Krugel, spokesman for the Arizona Department of Transportation. 
The corridor's $916 million design and construction contract makes it Arizona’s largest highway project, according to the ADOT. 
Here is the construction work that is underway in parts of the Valley. Facebook Posted! A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. Iron worker Kyle Poffenberger works on the future Loop 202 South Mountain Freeway near 40th Street and Pecos Road. The 22-mile freeway is expected to open by late 2019 and will provide a link between the East Valley and West Valley. Parker Leavitt/ The Republic ADOT has posted “no trespassing signs” in dozens of windows along Redwood Lane in Ahwatukee. Demolition work begins Aug. 26. Parker Leavitt/The Republic A few residents still remain, not yet having accepted the state’s purchase offer. Signs of life include a child’s scooter tipped over in a front yard. Parker Leavitt/The Republic Mail service still continues in Goldman Ranch, but many of the slots go unused and have their numbers worn off. Parker Leavitt/The Republic Eventually, ADOT expects to demolish 73 of 84 houses within Goldman Ranch Parker Leavitt/The Republic A dried-up fountain is one of many lingering monuments to life in the neighborhood before the freeway construction. Parker Leavitt/The Republic Many of the homes show signs of decay, like broken outdoor lighting, peeling paint or punctured window screens. Parker Leavitt/The Republic The Arizona Department of Transportation is preparing to demolish dozens of homes in the South Mountain Freeway path, including these in Ahwatukee’s Goldman Ranch.
